channel.title: Started in liberty Basic
channel.description:
Hey guys, I've currently bought a programming book, I'm going through it step by step and the first hour is Liberty basic, I've attempted to make an staff application With it meaning you enter the required information and then submit it. All i have done is Make a button which does nothing and added a few text boxes with a text beside them stating what that box is for.. anyway, I am trying to get the "Submit application" button to save the window in a txt document which i have do not have a clue on what to do.. here is my code.. [code]
[setup.main.Window]
nomainwin WindowWidth = 550 WindowHeight = 410 UpperLeftX=int((DisplayWidth-WindowWidth)/2) UpperLeftY=int((DisplayHeight-WindowHeight)/2) open "Application!" for window as #main
statictext #main.statictext1, "Username", 5, 2, 63, 20 TextboxColor$ = "white" textbox #main.textbox2, 90, 2, 100, 25 statictext #main.statictext3, "Password", 5, 27, 60, 20 textbox #main.textbox4, 90, 27, 100, 25 statictext #main.statictext5, "Email", 5, 62, 34, 20 textbox #main.textbox6, 50, 57, 245, 25 statictext #main.statictext7, "What Position are you applying for?", 5, 87, 210, 20 textbox #main.textbox8, 220, 87, 295, 25 textbox #main.textbox9, 100, 602, 100, 25 statictext #main.statictext10, "Why do you deserve your position?", 0, 117, 210, 20 statictext #main.statictext12, "Extra Info", 65, 277, 54, 20 button #main.button14,"Submit Application",[button14Click], UL, 165, 352, 121, 25 ComboboxColor$ = "white" combobox #main.combobox15, array$(, [combobox15DoubleClick], 615, 37, 100, 100 textbox #main.textbox16, 215, 267, 325, 80 textbox #main.textbox17, 215, 117, 325, 150
open "untitled" for window as #main print #main, "font ms_sans_serif 10" print #main, "trapclose [quit.main]"
[main.inputLoop] 'wait here for input event wait
[button14Click] 'Perform action for the button named 'button14'
wait
[combobox15DoubleClick] 'Perform action for the combobox named 'combobox15'
wait
[quit.main] close #main end
[/code] Any idea on Making my submit Button make the page Save to the desktop as a text document? Eh help me out. Dont flame me either because i've never used this Langauge.

item.title: Started in liberty Basic
item.dc:creator: @PLayRooney PLayRooney
item.description:
@PLayRooney wrote:

Hey guys, I’ve currently bought a programming book, I’m going through it step by step and the first hour is Liberty basic, I’ve attempted to make an staff application With it meaning you enter the required information and then submit it. All i have done is Make a button which does nothing and added a few text boxes with a text beside them stating what that box is for…
anyway, I am trying to get the “Submit application” button to save the window in a txt document which i have do not have a clue on what to do… here is my code…




[setup.main.Window]


    nomainwin
    WindowWidth = 550
    WindowHeight = 410
    UpperLeftX=int((DisplayWidth-WindowWidth)/2)
    UpperLeftY=int((DisplayHeight-WindowHeight)/2)
    open "Application!" for window as #main



    statictext #main.statictext1, "Username",   5,   2,  63,  20
    TextboxColor$ = "white"
    textbox #main.textbox2,  90,   2, 100,  25
    statictext #main.statictext3, "Password",   5,  27,  60,  20
    textbox #main.textbox4,  90,  27, 100,  25
    statictext #main.statictext5, "Email",   5,  62,  34,  20
    textbox #main.textbox6,  50,  57, 245,  25
    statictext #main.statictext7, "What Position are you applying for?",   5,  87, 210,  20
    textbox #main.textbox8, 220,  87, 295,  25
    textbox #main.textbox9, 100, 602, 100,  25
    statictext #main.statictext10, "Why do you deserve your position?",   0, 117, 210,  20
    statictext #main.statictext12, "Extra Info",  65, 277,  54,  20
    button #main.button14,"Submit Application",[button14Click], UL, 165, 352, 121,  25
    ComboboxColor$ = "white"
    combobox #main.combobox15, array$(, [combobox15DoubleClick],  615,  37, 100, 100
    textbox #main.textbox16, 215, 267, 325,  80
    textbox #main.textbox17, 215, 117, 325, 150



    open "untitled" for window as #main
    print #main, "font ms_sans_serif 10"
    print #main, "trapclose [quit.main]"


[main.inputLoop]   'wait here for input event
    wait



[button14Click]   'Perform action for the button named 'button14'

    wait


[combobox15DoubleClick]   'Perform action for the combobox named 'combobox15'


    wait

[quit.main] 
    close #main
    end

Any idea on Making my submit Button make the page Save to the desktop as a text document?
Eh help me out.
Dont flame me either because i’ve never used this Langauge.

Read full topic
